title: 14g "121 Recipe"
preparation_steps: Add coffee to V60 and tare scale

brewing_steps.audio_script: Start timer. Pour 40 grams for the bloom. Now wait. We're doing a long bloom, up to a minute and a half. Adjust based on how fresh your beans are.
First pour. Pour in the center with a small circular motion, about the size of a quarter. Bring the weight to 120 grams.
Final pour. Bring the total weight to 200 grams. Maintain that center-focused pour.
Give it a very minor swirl, then let it draw down. Aim for a finish time around 3 minutes 15 seconds.

what_to_expect.description: Known as the '121 Recipe' by the community, this method uses a coarser grind and center-focused pouring to maximize sweetness and minimize bitterness in specialty beans.
what_to_expect.audio_script: The 121 recipe is a community favorite for specialty beans. By using a coarser grind and center pouring, we avoid over-agitating the fines, resulting in a remarkably sweet and clean cup.

notes: Called the '121 recipe' by users. Works very well with specialty beans. Grind as coarse as possible without under-extraction.
